events.title: Sack of Rome
events.description: Troops of Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, sack Rome, marking the end of the Renaissance in Italy and significant weakening of the Papal States.
events.significance: This event dramatically shifted the balance of power in Italy and Europe, initiating changes in the religious and political landscape of Europe.

events.title: American Red Cross Founded
events.description: Clara Barton founds the American Red Cross, an organization dedicated to emergency assistance, disaster relief, and education in the United States.
events.significance: The American Red Cross played a crucial role in providing humanitarian aid and shaping emergency response strategies in the US and abroad.

events.title: Charles Lindbergh Completes First Solo Transatlantic Flight
events.description: Charles Lindbergh lands his airplane, the Spirit of St. Louis, in Paris, completing the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight from New York to Paris.
events.significance: This pioneering flight marked a major milestone in aviation history and inspired advances in commercial air travel.

events.title: Croatian War of Independence Begins
events.description: The Battle of Vukovar begins, marking a significant escalation in the Croatian War of Independence against Yugoslav forces.
events.significance: This conflict was central to the dissolution of Yugoslavia and reshaped the political boundaries in the Balkans.

events.title: Death of Ronald Reagan
events.description: Ronald Reagan, 40th President of the United States, dies at the age of 93.
events.significance: Reagan was a pivotal figure in late 20th-century American politics, known for his conservative policies and influence in ending the Cold War.
